intro: Thryptomene davisiae, commonly known as the pink thryptomene, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalypts and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, pink or white flowers that appear in clusters, typically during spring. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often aromatic when crushed. Thryptomene davisiae is typically found in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
